page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: Green Belt area so countryside is protected from building developments. Many footpaths and bridleways in use. Fauna: Roe deer, badgers, foxes, grey squirrel, lizards, grass snakes, adders, toads, field and wood mice, voles, shrews, weasels. Birds: Heron, pheasants, partridge, woodcock, pigeon, tawny owl, green & spotted woodpeckers, robin, wren, tree creeper, nuthatch, greater, long tailed, cole & blue tit, jay, magpie, blackbird, hedge sparrow. Flora: Typical mixed deciduous & coniferous trees-oak, beech, birch, chestnut, pine. Typical heathland plants in open spaces-more bracken than heather since not recently burned over. Special interest* Ewhurst named for yew trees, not plentiful now. Billberries abound known as "Hurts".
